name.en: Advanced Seminar in Cognition and Learning

department.ch: 學習與教學研究所碩士班

goal.ch:
修習本課程後，學習者
1)能理解、應用與批判重要學習理論
2)能發展學習理論整合框架
3)能以學習理論批判與設計教育場域
4)能發展英文文獻閱讀技巧與文獻摘要撰寫能力
goal.en:
Participants will be able to: 
1. Understand, apply, and critically evaluate important learning theories.
2. Develop a framework for integrating learning theories.  
3. Critique and design educational settings using learning theories.
4. Develop English literature reading skills and the ability to write literature summaries.

outline.ch:
這是一門修練「學習理論內功」的課，不是「堆積學習理論知識」的課程。
看過金庸的「倚天屠龍記」吧！故事的主角張無忌，在修練了乾坤大挪移之後，突然對於各個流派的武功有了進一步的體會。簡言之，他看到了武功的門道。武俠人物看到的門道，和研究學習理論的專家看到的門道當然不同，但其中有異曲同工之妙。
學習專家可以看到更深層的結構，而非表象。他們看到一個學習現象 (比方說，一群兒童在庭院裡嬉戲) 的時候，可以從語言發展，遊戲，認知，或者社會文化各種不同的角度去詮釋這個現象，他們能夠選擇適切的理論角度來詮釋學習如何被設計與發生。
某些研究學習的專家(如學習科學家)，還能夠「同時」從不同的學習觀點切入，設計學習情境。為學習者設計好的學習經驗(designing learning experience)，是目前教師最重要的能力。這門課，希望能夠讓修課的同學淺嚐學習專家看到的門道以及看門道的方法。
我們要強調的是，目前看到的這個課綱在和修課同學討論以前，都只是計畫。我希望在第一堂課和同學討論與溝通，在 「不改變這門課的核心價值與理念下」，共同建構這門課的內容與形式。這門課的終極目標，不是拿學分，得到好成績。希望在這門課的過程中，你能發現你自己並培養看待學習的方法。
修練內容：五大「學習單元」
我們透過閱讀學習理論的經典來明暸看待學習的方法。本課並非介紹學習理論歷史的課，而是透過幾個和「專家與生手」的學習相關的主題與理論來學習如何看待學習。
選定的主題包括五大「學習單元」：
1. 專家與生手(1)
2. 專家與生手(2)
3. 情境認知
4. 學習社群
5. 設計學習社群
授課方式
1.翻轉教室：每一個「學習單元」都從「學習者」精研指定文章開始開始，繼之以線上討論，面對面的討論授課，則展開解惑與深入文章理論精髓的對話。
2.深入對話：透過蘇格拉底式對話來了解學習理論的精髓。
3.深入反省：結合閱讀、討論與場域觀察研究，讓學習理論成為了解學習的工具。
outline.en:
This is a course that practices “Internal Martial Arts of Learning,“ not a course for simply accumulating knowledge of learning theories.
Have you read Jin Yong‘s “The Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber“? The protagonist, Zhang Wuji, after practicing the Great Shift of the Universe, suddenly gains further insights into various martial arts schools. In short, he sees the essence of martial arts. What martial arts characters see as the essence differs from what experts studying learning theories see, but there is a similarity in their understanding.
Learning experts can see deeper structures, not just surface appearances. When they observe a learning phenomenon (for example, a group of children playing in a courtyard), they can interpret it from various perspectives such as language development, play, cognition, or socio-cultural aspects. They can choose appropriate theoretical perspectives to interpret how learning is designed and occurs.
Some experts studying learning (such as learning scientists) can also simultaneously approach from different learning viewpoints to design learning contexts. Designing good learning experiences for learners is currently the most important skill for educators. This course aims to give students a taste of the insights and methods seen by learning experts.
It‘s important to emphasize that the curriculum currently presented is just a plan and hasn‘t been discussed with students. I hope to discuss and communicate with students in the first class, collectively constructing the content and format of this course while not altering its core values and principles. The ultimate goal of this course is not just to earn credits or get good grades. I hope that through this course, you can discover yourself and cultivate your own approach to understanding learning.
Training Content: Five Major “Learning Units“ We will explore methods of understanding learning through reading classic learning theory texts. This course is not a history of learning theory; rather, it focuses on several themes and theories related to “experts and novices“ in learning. The selected themes include five major “learning units“:
1.Experts and Novices (1)
2.Experts and Novices (2)
3.Situated Cognition
4.Learning Communities
5.Designing Learning Communities
Teaching Methodology
1.Flipped Classroom: Each “learning unit“ begins with intensive study of designated articles as “learners,“ followed by online and face-to-face discussions. Face-to-face sessions aim to clarify and engage in in-depth conversations about the essence of the theories presented in the readings.
2.Socratic Dialogue: Understanding the essence of learning theories through Socratic dialogue.
3.Deep Reflection: Combining reading, discussion, and field observation research to make learning theories a tool for understanding learning.

flexDiscription.ch: 彈性教學由學生針對期末作業的撰寫與教師個別討論，並根據教師指導完成「學習歷程檔案集」
flexDiscription.en: Flexible teaching involves students individually discussing their final assignments with the teacher and completing a "Learning Portfolio" based on the teacher's guidance.
